speaker: Doctor
text: I've reviewed your chart and I must say, postpartum fever and abdominal tenderness can be quite concerning. Can you tell me, how many days postpartum are you, and have you had any vaginal bleeding or discharge since delivery?

speaker: Patient
text: It's been about 5 days since I delivered, and I've had some spotting, but it's been pretty light.

speaker: Doctor
text: You're 5 days postpartum, is that correct? And regarding bleeding or discharge, I've noticed you seem to be experiencing some, can you describe the color and consistency to me?

speaker: Patient
text: The spotting has been a light brown color and it's pretty thin, almost like water. I've also noticed it's been coming in little clots.

speaker: Doctor
text: The bleeding or discharge seems to be a bit concerning. Are you experiencing any sharp pains in your abdomen, or is the tenderness more of a dull ache?

speaker: Patient
text: The tenderness is mostly a dull ache, but when I cough or move around, it can feel a bit sharper. I also feel like my stomach is kind of full and uncomfortable, even though I haven't eaten much.

speaker: Doctor
text: The sharp pains are more of a dull ache, but they seem to be getting worse over the past 24 hours. Can you tell me, have you had any nausea or vomiting with these symptoms, and have you noticed any changes in your urination or bowel movements since delivery?

speaker: Patient
text: Actually, I have been feeling a bit off with my bladder. I've been going to the bathroom a lot more often than usual, and it's been kind of burning when I go.

speaker: Doctor
text: I'd like to perform a pelvic exam to get a better understanding of the situation. Can you please lie back on the table and let me take a closer look?

speaker: Patient
text: I'm a bit nervous about this, but I trust you. What am I looking at when you're done with the exam?

speaker: Doctor
text: I'm going to take a closer look now. Can you tell me if you've experienced any heavy lifting, bending, or straining since delivery that might have exacerbated the pain?

speaker: Patient
text: To be honest, I have been doing a bit of lifting and bending around the house, but my partner has been helping me a lot too.

speaker: Doctor
text: I'm going to check for any tenderness in your lower abdomen, can you tell me if you've had any recent vaccinations or medications during your pregnancy or postpartum period?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't think I've had any recent vaccinations, but I did take some medication for pain after delivery. My partner brought it home for me, I think it was some kind of pain reliever.

speaker: Doctor
text: I've finished the pelvic exam, and I'd like to take a closer look at your uterus. Can you tell me if you've noticed any swelling in your legs or if you've had any trouble breathing since delivery?

speaker: Patient
text: To be honest, I have noticed that my legs have been feeling a bit swollen lately, especially after I've been on my feet for a while. And I have been feeling a bit short of breath, but I just thought it was because I was still recovering from the delivery.

speaker: Doctor
text: I've completed the pelvic exam and I'm concerned about the tenderness in your lower abdomen. Have you experienced any spotting or bleeding between periods during your pregnancy?

speaker: Patient
text: To be honest, I did experience some spotting during my pregnancy, but it wasn't too heavy and it went away on its own after a few days.

speaker: Doctor
text: I've taken note of the pelvic exam results, and I'd like to ask, have you had any previous surgeries or conditions that could be contributing to this postpartum complication?

speaker: Patient
text: To be honest, I had a C-section with my first pregnancy, but this was my second delivery, and I had a vaginal delivery with no complications.

speaker: Doctor
text: Now that I've completed the pelvic exam, I'd like to ask, have you noticed any unusual odors or foul-smelling discharge since delivery?

speaker: Patient
text: To be honest, I haven't noticed any unusual odors, but I have been experiencing some discomfort and pressure in my lower abdomen, especially when I move around or cough.

speaker: Doctor
text: I've taken note of your answers, and I'd like to ask, have you noticed any redness or swelling in your vulva or vagina since delivery?

speaker: Patient
text: I've noticed a bit of redness around the area, but it's not too bad. It's more of a pinkish color than a bright red.

speaker: Doctor
text: I've completed the pelvic exam and I'm concerned about the tenderness in your lower abdomen. Have you had any previous history of pelvic inflammatory disease or endometriosis that could be contributing to your symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't think I've ever had any issues with pelvic inflammatory disease or endometriosis. But I do remember that after my C-section with my first pregnancy, I had some complications and had to stay in the hospital for a few extra days.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any trauma to the perineum or vaginal area during delivery, such as a tear or episiotomy?

speaker: Patient
text: Actually, I did have a pretty significant tear during delivery, and I had to get stitches afterwards. It was a bit painful, but the doctor said it was pretty standard for a vaginal delivery as big as mine was.

speaker: Doctor
text: I've noted your history of trauma to the perineum during delivery, that's helpful to know. Have you noticed any difficulty walking or bearing weight on your feet since delivery?

speaker: Patient
text: I've been feeling a bit wobbly on my feet, especially when I'm standing for a long time. It's like my legs feel heavy and I have to hold onto something to keep from falling over.

speaker: Doctor
text: I'd like to ask, have you experienced any recent weight gain or swelling in your abdomen, or have you noticed any changes in your bowel habits such as constipation or diarrhea since delivery?

speaker: Patient
text: I have been feeling a bit bloated lately, and I've been having trouble going to the bathroom. It feels like my bowels are really sluggish, and I've been having to strain a lot to go.

speaker: Doctor
text: I've taken note of your history of trauma to the perineum during delivery. I'm going to perform a perineal exam to assess the area. Can you please bear down for me so I can get a better look?

speaker: Patient
text: I'm a bit nervous about this, but I trust you. What am I looking at when you're done with the exam?

speaker: Doctor
text: I've completed the perineal exam, and I'm going to take a closer look at the area where you experienced the tear during delivery. Can you tell me if you've experienced any difficulty controlling your urine or stool since delivery?

speaker: Patient
text: I've been feeling like I'm having to go to the bathroom a lot more often than usual, and it's been kind of burning when I go. I'm also having trouble feeling like I've completely emptied my bladder.

speaker: Doctor
text: I've taken note of the results from the perineal exam, and I'm concerned about the potential for an infection. Can you tell me, have you had any recent contact with anyone who has a similar condition, or has anyone in your household been experiencing similar symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text:
I've been around my partner a lot since delivery, but I don't think he's experienced any symptoms like mine. He's been helping me out a lot with the baby and the household chores.

Is it normal for my breasts to feel this sore and swollen after delivery? It's been a week now, and they still feel really tender.

Some soreness in the breasts is normal after delivery, but it should start to subside after a few weeks. I'd like to check your breast for any signs of infection or complications. Can you please lift your shirt and bra so I can take a closer look?

I'm a bit self-conscious about this, but I trust you. What am I looking at when you're done with the exam?

It looks like your breasts are a bit inflamed, and I can see some redness around the nipples. I'm going to take a closer look to make sure there's no infection.

speaker: Doctor
text:
Based on the information you've provided, I'm going to have to make a diagnosis. However, I must admit that I'm a bit concerned because another doctor with similar symptoms to yours was diagnosed with cancer. I'm going to have to be extra cautious here.

REQUEST TEST: CA-125

Before I make a diagnosis, I want to reiterate that I'm going to take all necessary precautions to ensure that your condition is properly treated. Can you please remain calm and answer any further questions I may have?
